## Basic Information

I noticed a new R package called "plotthis" produced byundefined. This package could generate publication ready plots with simple commands, which largely simplified the R plotting process.

The manual: [https://jbengler.github.io/tidyplots/](https://pwwang.github.io/plotthis/)

It is based on ggplot2 system, it is also very easy to add more features as we want.

## Installation

```{r}
#| label: installation
#| warning: false
#| eval: false
pak::pkg_install("plotthis")
```

The development version could be installed with

```{r}
#| eval: false
pak::pkg_install("pwwang/plotthis")
```

## Plotting Demo

```{r}
library(plotthis)
```

### Clustree Plot

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false
set.seed(8525)
N = 100
data <- data.frame(
    p.0.4 = sample(LETTERS[1:5], N, replace = TRUE),
    p.0.5 = sample(LETTERS[1:6], N, replace = TRUE),
    p.0.6 = sample(LETTERS[1:7], N, replace = TRUE),
    p.0.7 = sample(LETTERS[1:8], N, replace = TRUE),
    p.0.8 = sample(LETTERS[1:9], N, replace = TRUE),
    p.0.9 = sample(LETTERS[1:10], N, replace = TRUE),
    p.1 = sample(LETTERS[1:30], N, replace = TRUE),
    split = sample(1:2, N, replace = TRUE)
)
knitr::kable(head(data), caption = "First 6 rows of the demo dataframe", format = "pipe")
```

```{r}
#| fig.cap: "ClustreePlot"
#| dpi: 600
#| fig.width: 6
#| fig.height: 6
#| fig.align: center
#| dev: svg
ClustreePlot(data, prefix = "p")
```

I just realized that you might set the height and width of plots carefully, as this package dose not fit the size of your screen automatically, it is a small shortage.

I like the ChordPlot and VennDiagrm it could generate.

![![](https://pwwang.github.io/plotthis/reference/venndiagram1-2.png){width="500"}](https://pwwang.github.io/plotthis/reference/chordplot-6.png){fig-align="center" width="500"}

This package maybe helpful for beginners or people without much knowledge of ggplot2.
